question: The electronic configuration of X and Y are given below:
X: <katex>$1s^{2}2s^{2}2p^{6}3s^{2}3p^{3}$</katex>
Y: <katex>$1s^{2}2s^{2}2p^{6}3s^{2}3p^{5}$</katex>
Which of the following is the correct molecular formula and type of bond formed between X and Y?
explanation: X has configuration ending in <katex>$3s^2 3p^3$</katex>, which corresponds to Phosphorus (P, valency 3 or 5).
Y has configuration ending in <katex>$3s^2 3p^5$</katex>, which corresponds to Chlorine (Cl, valency 1).
They form <katex>$PCl_3$</katex> (XY3), which involves sharing of electrons, hence a covalent bond.
